The timeline of the HSBC Hackathon is as follows:
*Friday 8:00pm - Release of Problem statements.
*Saturday 12:00pm - Deadline for submission of abstract of the problems.
*Sunday 8:00am - Presentations of solutions begin.

The technical rules are as follows:

·         Source code used for solving the problems needs to be submitted along with the proposals

·         Any open source information which is prohibited under the law of the land should not be used for the purpose of Hackathon

·         No illegal web scrapping is allowed

Teams found to be not adhering to the above rules will be automatically disqualified from the Hackathon.

Hurry up, the registrations close tonight at 11:59pm

The registration form for the hackathon is:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfiEKYZ5rui3dEyCuMYG8O0i6k_AZkn7Gn75O94evSM5blIHA/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1

CodeClub in association with HSBC is organizing a hackathon in the area of Financial Analytics from 29th March 2019 (Friday) to 31st March 2019 (Sunday). The hackathon involves application of Machine Learning/ Artificial Intelligence in solving real life business problems.

The registration form for the hackathon is:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfiEKYZ5rui3dEyCuMYG8O0i6k_AZkn7Gn75O94evSM5blIHA/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1

The deadline for registration is tomorrow (27/03/19) EOD.

There are some attractive prizes in terms of Amazon gift vouchers worth 50k that will be handed over to the winners.

The generic rules for participation are as follows:

·         Teams will be consisting of at least 2 members and at most 5 members

·         Teams can be formed with inter department members

·         Teams will be informed about multiple problems at 8pm on Friday

·         Teams have to submit an abstract of the problems by Sat 12 noon

·         Teams will have to present their solution from 8am onwards on Sunday in the form of a presentation to HSBC panel

The technical rules are as follows:

·         Source code used for solving the problems needs to be submitted along with the proposals

·         Any open source information which is prohibited under the law of the land should not be used for the purpose of Hackathon

·         No illegal web scrapping is allowed

Teams found to be not adhering to the above rules will be automatically disqualified from the Hackathon.

Happy to let you know that we are organizing a finance based hackathon sponsored by HSBC during 29th march evening till 31st march evening. There will be 3 very interesting business problems in the area of Financial Analytics, and we hope students with interests in Financial Analytics and application of Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence in solving real life business problem will enjoy working on them. There are some attractive prizes in terms of Amazon gift vouchers that will be handed over to the winners.

There is a curtain raiser of the event on 25th March (Monday) which will give an introduction of the event and an overview of the business problems.

Time: 6:00-7:00pm 25th March
Venue: NR121
Topic: Curtain Raiser

Hello Everyone !!

As you all know, the Pre-Final Year Internships are the starting point of our journey as adults, as more often than not the choice we make at this stage shall pave the path for our future endeavours. 
We know how sometimes the magnitude and importance of things tend to instil fear and one can get intimidated at the prospect of such a life-changing turn of events.

So we at Code Club, IIT Kharagpur have taken up an initiative to bring to you small blogs from your seniors and batchmates to help you learn from their experience, to follow their tips and not to commit the mistakes they did. 

We start off with the writeup of our Department Representative Sree Theerdha who will be interning at Facebook London in the Summers of 2019. 

https://medium.com/@sreetheerdha9/my-internship-experience-with-facebook-london-fee27467ca08

Dear Coders,

Introducing, HackBMU 2.0, a 24 hour, open-themed hackathon, brought to you by Wolfram Language, Creative Tim, and Digital Ocean at 67th Milestone, the annual techno-cultural management fest of BML Munjal University.

Last year, HackBMU 1.0 garnered huge attention with 100+ participants from all over the country. Also, we aimed to close the gender gap in hackathon participation and encouraged female participants to join up by reserving seats especially for them. In this year's edition, 20% of the seats are reserved for female participants along with some special prizes and swags.
The event will host some of the best upcoming engineers and developers from all over the country to hack a wide range of problems in mobile, web and hardware technologies for 24 rigorous hours and present the same in front of a panel of the most esteemed judges from the industry. 

The prizes at HackBMU run up to worth ₹14 lakhs+ with a cash prize of ₹10,000. We have something for everyone attending the hackathon.

The registration is free of cost. Don’t wait, just start registering as seats are limited. Also, don’t worry if you are registering as an individual. The HackBMU team will help you form a team at the event considering your strengths, needs, and wants.

So, mark your calendar for the weekend of 9th and 10th February, register individually or as a team, and come to BML Munjal University, for the most creative 30 hours you'll spend this year. You also get to experience the thrilling performance of DJ Zaeden.

For registrations visit: https://hackbmu.com

Hurry Up! Go get yourself registered because opportunities don’t know twice at your door.

The prizes at HackBMU run up to worth ₹14 lakhs+ with a cash prize of ₹10,000. We have something for everyone attending the hackathon.

The registration is free of cost. Don’t wait, just start registering as seats are limited. Also, don’t worry if you are registering as an individual. The HackBMU team will help you form a team at the event considering your strengths, needs, and wants.

So, mark your calendar for the weekend of 9th and 10th February, register individually or as a team, and come to BML Munjal University, for the most creative 30 hours you'll spend this year. You also get to experience the thrilling performance of DJ Zaeden.

For registrations visit: https://hackbmu.com

Hurry Up! Go get yourself registered because opportunities don’t know twice at your door.

Dear Coders,

Introducing, HackBMU 2.0, a 24 hour, open-themed hackathon, brought to you by Wolfram Language, Creative Tim, and Digital Ocean at 67th Milestone, the annual techno-cultural management fest of BML Munjal University.

Last year, HackBMU 1.0 garnered huge attention with 100+ participants from all over the country. Also, we aimed to close the gender gap in hackathon participation and encouraged female participants to join up by reserving seats especially for them. In this year's edition, 20% of the seats are reserved for female participants along with some special prizes and swags.
The event will host some of the best upcoming engineers and developers from all over the country to hack a wide range of problems in mobile, web and hardware technologies for 24 rigorous hours and present the same in front of a panel of the most esteemed judges from the industry. 

The prizes at HackBMU run up to worth ₹14 lakhs+ with a cash prize of ₹10,000. We have something for everyone attending the hackathon.

The registration is free of cost. Don’t wait, just start registering as seats are limited. Also, don’t worry if you are registering as an individual. The HackBMU team will help you form a team at the event considering your strengths, needs, and wants.

So, mark your calendar for the weekend of 9th and 10th February, register individually or as a team, and come to BML Munjal University, for the most creative 30 hours you'll spend this year. You also get to experience the thrilling performance of DJ Zaeden.

For registrations visit: https://hackbmu.com

Hurry Up! Go get yourself registered because opportunities don’t know twice at your door.

It gives us immense pleasure to announce that Rapid Programming Hub, in association with CodeChef, is back again with its Flagship Event “Algoflux 2019” being organised every year on Converge. 
Algoflux is an ACM-ICPC style inter-college competitive programming contest, a team event designed to challenge competitive programmers with problems based on various data structures and algorithms. This contest is held in two rounds. We present to you details for the same:

Round 1 - Qualifiers 
Date : 27th January, 2019 
Timings : 9PM to 12AM 
Team Size : 2-3 Members 
According to the performance, teams will be shortlisted for Onsite Finals.

Round 2 - Onsite Final 
Date : 3rd February, 2019 
Timings : 10:00 AM Onwards (Duration 5Hrs)
Venue : CL2, JIIT128

General Rules:
1- Registration for Online Qualifier closes on 27th Jan at 6:00 PM. 
2- Duplicate Registrations are not allowed.
3- Duplicate Submission and Code Sharing is strictly prohibited, any instance of it would lead to disqualification.
4- Top 3 teams will be awarded. 
5- All students with valid student identity card of their respective Educational Institution are eligible for participation.

Kindly Register Here For Participating.
Registration Link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe_xrRCd2_jGPpwacK2DUtOVM7vfo9B7D6UGlcmsJjdNoqKqQ/viewform
Note: Contest Link will be provided via mail after team registration.

We are delighted to invite you to this Coding Competition organised by The LNM Institute of Information Technology – Jaipur, during the two day Techno-Management-Literary Fest Plinth'19 to be held from 19th – 20th January, 2019.

The contest shall be a great opportunity for students to whet their programming aptitude. This national level programming contest shall assess the intelligence of participants through various rounds. It is an Online Qualifier Round for the Onsite Round to be held during Plinth'19. 

There will be 2 rounds to decide the winner: 
1. First Round: Online round will be held on 6th January, 2019 on Codechef. 
2. Second Round: Onsite round will be held at The LNM Institute of Information Technology, Jaipur. More details will be announced later. 

The Contest details of IUPC'19 are as follows: 
- Contest duration will be 5 hours. 
- Team with maximum of 3 members is allowed. 
- Start time: 6th January 2019, 21:00 hrs IST 
- End time: 7th January 2019, 02:00 hrs IST

Do you find little riddles intriguing? Is there a Sherlock hidden in you that jumps out whenever someone asks a riddle? Then, here's a chance for you to shine...........
ANWESHA 2k19,the techno-cultural fest of IIT PATNA brings the ultimate treasure hunt to you.
NJATH, where you read, analyze, hunt, solve, decipher, decode and then repeat if you haven't found what you want. But mind you, this journey won't be easy. Well, if the treasure is precious, so strive you have to, for achieving it.

See, think, and hunt. Well, this is the hunt of a lifetime, adventure extraordinaire, because this is 'not just another treasure hunt'.

To participate, all you have to do is create a anwesha id and register for NJATH at www.anwesha.info

Here's a warm up question
Search me at a "random" location. You'll find me. But give me the number to reach me without actually reaching me. I am in a hairpin but nowhere near hair. Give me the correct answer if you
dare!!
https://m.facebook.com/anwesha.iitpatna/photos/a.172775642755089/2265548143477818/?type=3&source=48

story: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared their post.
message: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared their post. Greetings Everyone !! With the ACM-ICPC Regionals going on, the Competitive Programming Fever is as high as it can get !! This skill is deemed to be almost indispensable nowadays and so CodeClub IIT Kharagpur presents to the students of KGP a series of lectures on Competitive Programming by veteran student coders from amongst us, the IIT Kharagpur Student Community. The lectures would be catering to two divisions - Division1( Advanced) and Division2( Beginner ) The Division1 Lectures will be taken by Pranjal Shankhdhar and Mayank Khetan ( ACM-ICPC World Finalists 2017-18 ) For more details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tFA7205EHwzsXwoNxfJS1hoj80_fLvBz9pr0z0xvTMM/edit The Division2 Lectures will be taken by Vivek Gupta, Nitish Rai, Arpit Jain and Himanshu Mundhra For more details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jL6ObLuXHwg1ADWpNX4JfXFF9_5aMhHcpbjRKXmntrs/edit These Classes will begin around the first few weeks of the Spring Semester. We are attaching a Google Form for your Registration. Selected students will be informed by mail about the first class. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSel2HyvM-sq4t1MalTzzHfx5Y4BMQGjbJ2sZpuuLBW_8AyYmA/viewform

Greetings Everyone !! 
With the ACM-ICPC Regionals going on, the Competitive Programming Fever is as high as it can get !! This skill is deemed to be almost indispensable nowadays and so CodeClub IIT Kharagpur presents to the students of KGP a series of lectures on Competitive Programming by veteran student coders from amongst us, the IIT Kharagpur Student Community.

The lectures would be catering to two divisions - 
Division1( Advanced) and Division2( Beginner )

The Division1 Lectures will be taken by Pranjal Shankhdhar and Mayank Khetan ( ACM-ICPC World Finalists 2017-18 ) 
For more details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tFA7205EHwzsXwoNxfJS1hoj80_fLvBz9pr0z0xvTMM/edit

The Division2 Lectures will be taken by Vivek Gupta, Nitish Rai, Arpit Jain and Himanshu Mundhra
For more details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jL6ObLuXHwg1ADWpNX4JfXFF9_5aMhHcpbjRKXmntrs/edit

These Classes will begin around the first few weeks of the Spring Semester. We are attaching a Google Form for your Registration. Selected students will be informed by mail about the first class.
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSel2HyvM-sq4t1MalTzzHfx5Y4BMQGjbJ2sZpuuLBW_8AyYmA/viewform

story: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared Computer Science & Engineering Department, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared Computer Science & Engineering Department, IIT Kharagpur's post. Talk@CSE Title: On the Complexity of Opinions and Online Discussions. Speaker: Manuel Gomez Rodriguez. Time: 11.30 AM. Date: 15th November. Venue: CSE 108. *Abstract*: In an increasingly polarized world, demagogues who reduce complexity down to simple arguments based on emotion are gaining in popularity. Are opinions and online discussions falling into demagoguery? In this work, we aim to provide computational tools to investigate this question and, by doing so, explore the nature and complexity of online discussions and their space of opinions, uncovering where each participant lies. More specifically, we present a modeling framework to construct latent representations of opinions in online discussions which are consistent with human judgments, as measured by online voting. If two opinions are close in the resulting latent space of opinions, it is because humans think they are similar. Our framework is theoretically grounded and establishes a surprising connection between opinion and voting models and the sign-rank of matrices. Moreover, it also provides a set of practical algorithms to both estimate the dimensionality of the latent space of opinions and infer where opinions expressed by the participants of an online discussion lie in this space. Experiments on a large dataset from Yahoo! News, Yahoo! Finance, Yahoo! Sports, and the Newsroom app show that many discussions are multisided, reveal a positive correlation between the complexity of a discussion, its linguistic diversity and its level of controversy, and show that our framework may be able to circumvent language nuances such as sarcasm or humor by relying on human judgments instead of textual analysis. *Speaker Bio*: Manuel Gomez Rodriguez is a tenure-track faculty at Max Planck Institute for Software Systems. Manuel develops machine learning and large-scale data mining methods for the analysis, modeling and control of large social and information systems. He is particularly interested in the creation, acquisition and/or dissemination of reliable knowledge and information, which is ubiquitous in the Web and social media, and has received several recognitions for his research, including an Outstanding Paper Award at NIPS’13 and a Best Research Paper Honorable Mention at KDD’10 and WWW’17. Manuel holds a BS in Electrical Engineering from Carlos III University in Madrid (Spain), a MS and PhD in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University, and has received postdoctoral training at the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems. You can find more about him at http://learning.mpi-sws.org.

story: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared up.AI Summit, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared up.AI Summit, IIT Kharagpur's post. Here's your chance to prove your AI aptitude. up.AI summit is organizing the first-ever J.A.R.V.I.S. Chronicles. Spanning over two days and two nights J.A.R.V.I.S. will test the depth and width of your knowledge. The first phase of the challenge starts from 00:00 hrs on Saturday (today) and will end at 08:00 hrs on the same day. Participants need to submit the code as well. Please find the problem statement at: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Nodjt2msWXjcPx5VbU7xWShfPuMLkVBf?usp=sharing Submission Link: https://www.kaggle.com/t/06e1ed87832747a1a625f6421064c321

The best way to test your understanding is to challenge yourself. So here is a contest, J.A.R.V.I.S. Chronicles where you solve some problems for making J.A.R.V.I.S. learn a few things, a fun way to learn to solve problems in AI. 
The contest is divided into two segments, Part 1 and Part 2. Part 1 is easier while Part 2 is relatively difficult. Each problem more challenging than the previous ones. 
The results will be declared during the closing ceremony and will count points obtained by participants in both the parts.
Top 3 performers will get cash prize worth of INR 15k, other top performers will get exciting goodies.
Only individual participation is allowed. 
Plagiarism would lead to disqualification.

More information to follow, stay tuned.
#FlyHighWithAI

Here is the summary of the up.AI Summit, IIT Kharagpur.
The summit comprises of three parts: bootcamp, workshop and challenge. The focus of the summit is to increase the participation of IIT Kharagpur students in the field of Artificial Intelligence and highlighting the role of AI in building a better future for all. The division of the summit is such that students consecutively learn about the field, understand its importance, apply to problems and implement their models.
A detailed schedule will be released soon.

#FlyHighWithAI
For more details visit: http://upai-summit.in
Twitter handle: @upai_summit

story: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
Code.fun.do is back with a different avatar "code.fun.do++",
a one of a kind tech challenge for students passionate about using technology to solve real-world problems.
This time a month-long online challenge with frequent webinars and even more amazing prizes.

This year’s challenge is to build state-of-the-art technology to predict and prevent the impact of natural disasters, such as earthquakes, hurricanes, and floods.
In a journey of four weeks, build your solution to predict natural disasters, using AI, ML, MR, VR, AR, IoT technologies on Microsoft Azure Cloud, under the guidance of Microsoft mentors.
Give yourself a chance to win prizes worth up to INR 50 Lakhs! 

Registrations closes at 11:59PM on October 5th.
For more details and registration visit: https://codefundo.io/

Are you waiting for a big break to showcase your work in the field of AI? You got it! Following the esteemed guests' lectures, up.AI Summit 2018 brings to you Spotlight: An event of unparalleled opportunity to place your shadowed AI research/work in the spotlight.

To showcase your work, submit a presentation as per the sample template given in the link below. The selected individual/team will be given a chance to showcase their work in front of esteemed people of the field during the summit.

Don't forget to submit your spotlight presentation before 30th of this month! Visit the website http://upai-summit.in for submitting your presentation and to know more about the events.

Follow us on Twitter @upAI_summit

Introducing our speaker!

We are pleased to announce Malaikannan Sankarasubbu as a speaker at the up.AI Workshop on 6th October.

Malaikannan Sankarasubbu is the VP of AI Research at saama.com. Prior to that, he was the founder and CTO of datalog.ai. He specializes in Deep Learning for Natural Language Understanding. He developed the popular chatbot design platform mypolly.ai during his time at Datalog. His current research at Saama focuses on using Deep Learning for accelerating clinical trials of medicines. An avid programmer with more than 12 years of industry experience, Malaikannan is keen about open source software development. He will speak about Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare.

Venue: Bhatnagar Auditorium
Time: 2:00 P.M
Date: 6th October

Please visit http://upai-summit.in/ to know more and register for the events.

Follow on Twitter @upAI_summit

We are pleased to have Subrat Kumar Panda as our speaker for the Industrial track at the up.AI Workshop on 6th October. 

Subrat is the Principal Architect - AI Technologies at Capillary Technologies, where he is working on AI-based omnichannel retail products. He has multiple patents and publications. He has received his Ph.D. in Computer Science and B.Tech. in Computer Science from IIT-KGP. Previously, he has worked in Taro (food tech startup), NVIDIA and IBM post his Ph.D. He is a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur. 
He will talk on Artificial Intelligence in Industry.

Be there to learn how AI is changing the landscape of omnichannel retail in our country.

Date: 6th October 2018
Time: 2:00 P.M
Venue: Raman Auditorium

story: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared up.AI Summit, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared up.AI Summit, IIT Kharagpur's post. Department of Computer Science and Engineering and Centre of Excellence in Artificial Intelligence, IIT Kharagpur present up.AI Summit 2018 with the motivation of exploring the potential of Artificial Intelligence (AI) for Social Good in India. Following the Deep Learning Revolution, AI has emerged as an extremely potent tool for solving tasks of high cognitive complexity, at scale. IIT Kharagpur is dedicated to the service of the Nation and the up.AI Summit will present a unique opportunity to the students, researchers, and faculty of the Institute to come together, learn, discuss and build effective AI-powered solutions for the numerous socio-economic problems in our country that cripple us from realizing the true potential of 1.35 billion people. The up.AI Summit 2018 comprises of three events: a three hour AI Bootcamp, a two-day Workshop with talks by invited speakers, Professors and students of IIT Kharagpur and a Challenge in which student-teams can propose ideas, 10 of which get selected for incubation and the top three finishers receive awards. Date: 5-7 October 2018 #FlyHighWithAI Please visit http://upai-summit.in to know more and register for the events. Follow us on Twitter @upAI_summit

NumPy(Numerical Python) is a linear algebra library in Python. It is a very important library on which almost every data science or machine learning Python package such as SciPy(Scientific Python), Mat-plotlib(plotting library), Scikit-learn, etc depends on to a reasonable extent.
NumPy is very useful for performing mathematical and logical operations on Arrays. It provides an abundance of useful features for operations on n-arrays and matrices in Python.

This is the first in a series of lectures that will deal with the very basics of deep learning so that you end up with a really cool mini-project at the end.

Date: 17/8/18 (Friday)
Time: 8-9 PM
Venue: 119, CSE Department

story: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared their post.
message: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared their post. Microsoft is back with their flagship coding competition code.fun.do. Following last year’s format all the 1st and 2nd year UG students need to compete in an online Hackathon out of which three teams will qualify for the final Hackathon. Attendance in the bootcamp is mandatory for UG 1st and 2nd year students. The online hackathon will be held between 6th March to 12th March whereas the on-campus round will be held over-night on March 24 9:00 AM to March 25 2:00 PM. Important registration deadlines : - -> Bootcamp - Registration - March 2, 11:59 PM -> Code.fun.do Online Qualifier - Team creation - March 8, 11:59 PM, Project Submission - March 12, 11:59 PM -> Code.fun.do On-campus - Team creation - March 21, 11:59 PM Registration link: https://aka.ms/cfdiitkgp

Finance Buddha is looking for summer interns who are interested in building scalable applications which involves business analytics, cutting edge tech & machine learning.

Apply if you qualify for the below requirements:

1) Studying in any Elite College (IIT/NIT/BITS) can apply.
2) Should have prior web/mobile app development experience.
3) Mandatory Technologies Required: HTML5/CSS3/JS/JQuery/PHP (MVC).
4) Knowledge of NodeJS/Webpack/Gulp/Angular/React & Express/CodeIgniter/Laravel is a plus.

(defun Codefest()
(terpri)

(princ "On March 1, 1960, the first LISP Programmer's Manual was released. Considered the mother tongue of Artificial Intelligence (AI), LISP is older than most other high-level languages still in use today. Created by John McCarthy, LISP became the first language to include recursion and conditional expressions. LISP is an example of a functional programming language, just as C++ and Java are examples of object-oriented languages.
What does LISP offer you?
Long story short: LISP offers you a stunning level of productivity which frees you to write complex, robust, understandable and evolving applications with an order-of-magnitude reduction in the associated pain. 
Codefest'18 celebrates the development of LISP and how without it, basic operations such as recursion, and the wonderful applications of AI would have been impossible."
)

(#Codefest)

Following last year’s format all the 1st and 2nd year UG students need to compete in an online Hackathon out of which three teams will qualify for the final Hackathon. Attendance in the bootcamp is mandatory for UG 1st and 2nd year students. The online hackathon will be held between 6th March to 12th March whereas the on-campus round will be held over-night on March 24 9:00 AM to March 25 2:00 PM. Greetings on behalf of Nurture.AI. We are pleased to inform you that Nurture.AI will be conducting AI Saturdays in Kharagpur. As we all know, that Artificial Intelligence is the new talk all over the world; why should Kharagpur stay behind! In this exciting initiative,  open and free for all AI sessions will be conducted in Kharagpur. This will be conducted in sync with a worldwide audience across the United States, Singapore, and other Indian cities. Each session every Saturday will be divided into 3 parts where we will implement AI algorithms, discuss research papers, online material and have some interesting discussions. 

The session will have a preliminary understanding of Python as a must and here are some resources to help you with that:
https://www.dataquest.io/  for a good guided Python introduction explanations and exercises: (Intro to Python available on free plan)

Python refresher + numpy+ matplotlib by Stanford (https://github.com/kuleshov/cs228-material/blob/master/tutorials/python/cs228-python-tutorial.ipynb)

Pandas tutorials(https://bitbucket.org/hrojas/learn-pandas)

We are very glad to be a part of this and hope you too will benefit from this initiative. 
The first session will be in January(tentatively on 13th January). All those interested kindly fill the registration form given below. The details regarding the sessions will be shared with the registered students soon. Also, this being a student initiative we request all interested research scholars and seniors to mentor us and help us make it a grand success. 

Let us all join this wave of change and be a part of a global community comprising eminent researchers, PhDs, and students. 

Sign-Up form:
https://goo.gl/forms/AluX7UZLVFL5bgIg1

For more details, contact:
Subham Rajgaria: 9830331068
Siddharth Singh: 8826219130

Technex-IIT (BHU) Varanasi presents the Kogence Simulation Challenge – a unique simulation hackathon supported by Amazon Web Services, NVIDIA and VMWare with cloud supercomputing platform support from Kogence, lucrative internship offers and $35,000 worth of prizes. Try your hands on simulations based on the leading technologies behind AI – Tensorflow, Keras, Scikit learn and Torch – in the Artificial Intelligence Challenge.
